p: We herein reviewed the best evidence on SARS-CoV-2 and neurological disorders simultaneously with COVID-19 neurological and psychiatric sequelae, including the paediatric population. Indeed, children affected by neurological disorders could be particularly vulnerable in the context of COVID-19, both directly because of their physical difficulties, but also because of the challenging issue of treatment needs alongside drugâ€™s long-term effects. These factors together with the adverse psychological effects of measures, such as self-isolation and disruption to normal healthcare and lifestyle, make this population worthy of attention [ 9, 10].
